revision.comment: /* Types and distributors of Sled Dogs brand snowskates */Sled Dogs is a brand of snowskates, not THE snowskates.
revision.text:
{{distinguish|snowskate}} {{refimprove|date=December 2015}} '''Snowskates''' are a type of snow sport equipment intended to allow the user to emulate the actions of [[ice skating]] or [[rollerblading]] on snow. They were first produced commercially in [[Germany]] in the 1930s.
Snowskates consist of a pair of flexible ski boots with integrated bases resembling [[sled]] runners that are approximately the same length as the boot itself, incorporating steel edges to grip the snow. [[File:Sleddogs snowskates Oslo, Norway.jpg|alt=Sleddogs snowskates Oslo, Norway|thumb|Sleddogs snowskates Oslo, Norway]]
Sled Dogs Snowskates is a winter sports company that is now owned and operated out of Oslo, Norway producing the current generation of snowskates. Since 2014, Sled Dogs Snowskates have produced a range of comfortable, lightweight snowskates for different user requirements (casual user to advanced user) Sled Dogs Snowskates combine the freedom and aggressive movements from inline skates and ice skates, with the freedom and challenge of slalom and snowboarding, without moving away from the key concept of 'Skates on Snow'.
''The similar term '''[[snowskating]]''' may also apply to a skateboard for use on snow (which is a shortened term of "snowskateboarding").''
== History == [[File:Metal snowskates from Holland, 1865.png|alt=Metal snowskates from Holland, 1865|thumb|Metal snowskates from Holland, 1865]] Snowskates were invented in [[Netherlands|The Netherlands]], and originally consisted of a simple wood runner that was tied to the users boots around 1865.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iceskatesmuseum.com/e-byz-sneeuw.htm|title=Snow skates|work=The virtual ice skates museum|accessdate=14 December 2015}}</ref>
The earliest versions came in many varieties and they were mostly custom-made as opposed to commercially produced. The more well-known, commercially produced models came from [[Germany]] in the 1950s. The modern version of snowskates was invented by Swiss inventor Hanes Jacob in the 1970s.
== Types and distributors of Sled Dogs brand snowskates == [[File:Available SledDogs snowskates types in season 2015-2016.jpg|alt=Available SledDogs snowskates types in season 2015–2016|thumb|493x493px|Available Sled Dogs snowskates types in season 2015–2016]] Multiple types of snowskates and accessories are available at the official website and at the official distributors in more than 30 countries around the World.
In 2017 there are distributors in Europe, Russia, Cyprus, Australia and New Zealand, China, South Korea, Canada, USA and in South America.
The available models are named after Norwegian dog breeds: The Halden is the entry-level model claiming 'all-round practicality and performance; the Lunde is a special women's fit with a fleece inner lining; the Hygen is the racing model. The K9.02 model is the top model designed for freestyle and professional level users.
== TV appearances == The skates were featured in British [[Channel 4]] TVs show "[[The Jump]]" where celebrities ([[Steve-O]], [[Dean Cain]], [[Heather Mills]], [[Brian McFadden]], [[Stacey Solomon]] etc.) were competing with SledDogs snowskates in series 2 in 2015 and in series 3 in 2016. Both series were watched by over 2,5 million viewers.<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Vs2yFZO-zk&</ref>
== SledDogs Bonefight race series == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Location !Women's 1St place !Men's 1st Place |- |20 December 2015 |[[Wagrain]], [[Austria]] |Alice Zenz (AUT) |Philip Auerswald (GER) |} [[File:Luca Dallago - First World Champion of SledDogs Bonefight series.jpg|thumb|SledDogs Bonefight World Champion 2015-216 Luca Dallago]] The first ever cross downhill competition using snowskates, called SledDogs Bonefight was held in [[Wagrain]], Austria on the 20th of December, 2015.<ref>http://sleddogsbonefight.com</ref><ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jwDLBLdHxZ8</ref> It was followed by 2 more races during the winter season of 2015–16. The next race was held in the biggest indoor ski slope of the World in Snowworld, Landgraaf, The Netherlands followed by the third race in Red Deer, Canada. The first ever SledDogs Bonefight World Champion was Luca Dallago who is also a top 10 athlete in [[Crashed Ice|RedBull Crashed Ice]] series.
The 2016/17 Bonefight tournament was held at slopes in Atholville and Nakiska in Canada and Wagrain in Austria. The World Champion in the women's tournament was jointly held by Karine Roy and Makara Martin, both from Canada, with Shaelyn Moltzahn, also from Canada, making up the top three. In the men's tournament, Luca Dallego from Austria held on to his world title for a second year, with Nathan Oostenbrink from Canada and Philipp Auerswald from Germany sharing second place.
The 2017/18 Bonefight tournament returned to Atholville and Wagrain and debuted at the Iceland Winter Games in Akureyri. Germany's Philipp Auerswald beat former title-holder Luca Dallago to the top spot in the men's event, with Canada's Samuel Nadeau taking third. Canada's Karine Roy took the No.1 spot for the women, followed by Iceland's Eva Maria Karvelsdottir and Finland's Miisa Klemola. The Freestyle Jump title was closely fought between Canada's Vincent Leblanc and Iceland's Isak Andri Bjarnason, with the title ultimately going to Bjarnason following a technical tie and an audience vote.
== Ingi Freyr Sveinbjörnsson == [[File:Ingi Freyr.jpg|alt=Ingi Freyr Sveinbjörnsson|thumb|Ingi Freyr Sveinbjörnsson]] [[Ingi Freyr Sveinbjörnsson]] from Iceland is the most famous skater on SledDogs snowskates. He was special advisor/coach on UK TV series "The Jump" and he was the Top freestyle snowskater in the first international tournament in 2015. He has also been on television in South Korea. He also developed the following tricks on SledDogs snowskates: 360, 540, 720, frontflip, play dead, the twisted donut. {{As of|June 2016}}, he held the fastest measured downhill speed record on SledDogs snowskates of {{convert|113|km/h}}.<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iKk9Yth12BU</ref> until April 2018, when Jari-Pekka Rahkonen of Finland broke the record with a speed of 115.27 km/h <ref>https://www.lapinkansa.fi/urheilu/katso-video-jari-pekka-rahkonen-rikkoi-lumiluistelun-maailmanennatyksen-sallatunturilla-200886916/</ref>
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
[[Category:Sports equipment]] [[Category:Footwear accessories]]

{{Infobox company | name = Spoken Web | type = Nonprofit | foundation = 2006 | industry = Technology | location = Tel Aviv, Israel | products = Web Portals and [[Screen Reader]] | homepage = {{URL|www.spoken-web.com}} }}
'''Spoken Web''' is a web portal, managing a wide range of online data-intensive content like Wikipedia articles, news updates, weather, travel and business articles for computer users who are blind or visually impaired. Spoken Web is based in [[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]].<ref>{{Citation | title = Spoken Web | url = http://www.spoken-web.com/index.cgi?p=about | accessdate = 2009-10-16 | publisher = Gartner }}</ref>
== History == Spoken Web was founded by [[Eyal Shalom]] in 2006.<ref>{{Citation | title = Profile | url = http://www.linkedin.com/company/spoken-web | accessdate = 2009-10-16 | publisher = Linkedin }}</ref>
== Core technology==
The site provides a simple, easy-to-use interface for navigating between the different sections and articles. Using the keyboard to navigate, everybody can hear the full range of an article content provided in a logical, clear, and understandable manner.<ref>{{Citation | title = Spoken Web | url = http://www.spoken-web.com/index.cgi?p=about | accessdate = 2009-10-16 | publisher = Gartner }}</ref>
Navigation uses three keys: 'TAB' to pass from item to item, 'Enter' to select an item and 'Backspace' to go back to previous page.
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Screen readers]] [[Category:Assistive technology]] [[Category:Speech synthesis]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Infobox company | name = Traveline | logo = Traveline.svg | fate = | predecessor = | successor = | foundation = 2000 | defunct = | location = | industry = | parent = }} '''Traveline''' is a [[public transport route planner]] service provided by a partnership between local authorities and transport operators in the UK to provide impartial and comprehensive information about public transport which has operated since 2000.<ref name=about>{{cite web|url=http://www.traveline.org.uk/aboutTL.htm|title=What is traveline?|publisher=Traveline|accessdate=8 February 2010}}</ref> It prepares comprehensive public transport data for the UK and provides a number of regional public transport journey planners.<ref name=pti>{{cite web|url=http://www.pti.org.uk/|title=Traveline Data|work=PTI|accessdate=8 February 2010}}</ref>
==History== {{see also|Transport Direct}} Following on from a successful prototype one number travel service developed by Lancashire County Council in 1999, the national Traveline organisation was established in 2000.<ref name=hist>{{cite web|url=http://www.travelinedata.org.uk/history.htm|title=History|publisher=Traveline|accessdate=8 February 2010}}</ref>
A prototype national door-to-door journey for [[Great Britain]] (i.e. UK without [[Northern Ireland]]) using the Lancashire Traveline model for regional journey planners was available for evaluation by 'stakeholders and key opinion formers' by November 2003 and the service was officially launched by [[Alistair Darling]], the then [[Secretary of State for Transport]] on 31 December 2004.<ref name=TDhist>{{cite web|url=http://www.dft.gov.uk/transportdirect/about/history|title=History and strategy|accessdate=7 January 2010}}</ref>
In March 2010 [[Gordon Brown]], the then [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] announced that the [[NaPTAN]] dataset would be released as [[Open Data]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://number10.gov.uk/news/speeches-and-transcripts/2010/03/speech-on-building-britains-digital-future-22897|archive-url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20100511083615/number10.gov.uk/news/speeches-and-transcripts/2010/03/speech-on-building-britains-digital-future-22897|dead-url=yes|archive-date=11 May 2010|title=Speech on Building Britain’s Digital Future|publisher=National Archives|accessdate=29 June 2010}}</ref>
==Operation== {{update section|date=December 2016}}
The Traveline regions assemble the public transport information within their areas and make it available through a number of local public transport journey planners. As of May 2014, all regions provide information for use within the [[Google Maps]] journey planner, and as of December 2016 all regions were added to the [[Apple Maps]] journey planner.<ref>{{Cite web |url =http://www.macrumors.com/2016/12/19/apple-maps-transit-united-kingdom/ |publisher =MacRumors |access-date =19 December 2016 |date =19 December 2016 |author =Rossignol, J. |title =Apple Maps Expands Transit Directions Across the United Kingdom}}</ref>
{| class="wikitable unsortable" |- ! Regional ! Journey planner ! Notes |- |East Anglia||MDV|| |- |East Midlands||MDV|| |- |London||MDV||[[Transport for London]] also operates its own MDV system<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tfl.gov.uk/assets/downloads/corporate/Item04-corporate-directors-report.pdf|title=Planning and corporate panel|publisher=Transport for London}}</ref> |- |North East & Cumbria||JourneyPlan|| |- |North West||Trapeze<ref name=which/>|| |- |Scotland||Trapeze<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.trapezegroup.co.uk/newsevents/cs_07_001.php|title=Case Study: Traveline Scotland|publisher=Trapeze|accessdate=2 March 2010}}</ref>|| |- |South East||MDV|| |- |South West||MDV<ref name=which/>|| |- |[[Traveline Cymru|Wales]]||Trapeze<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.trapezegroup.co.uk/newsevents/cs_07_002.php|title=Case Study: PTI Cymru & Modus|publisher=Trapeze|accessdate=27 March 2010}}</ref>|| |- |West Midlands||MDV|| |- |Yorkshire||Trapeze<ref name=which>{{cite web|url=http://217.171.103.34/|title=Which Website were you after ?|publisher=Trapeze|accessdate=27 March 2010}}</ref>|| |- |}
Details of all bus stops in the country are assembled into the [[NaPTAN|National Public Transport Access Nodes database (NaPTAN)]] which is updated daily. The organisation also maintains the associated National Public Transport Gazetteer of all place names, both formal and informal, that may be used to indicate the destination for a requested journey. These datasets are provided to both [[Google Maps]] and [[OpenStreetMap]]. They have also been released as [[Open Data]] via [[data.gov.uk]].
Public transport schedules are provided for use with the [[Transport Direct Portal]] on a weekly basis for use within the 'national journey planner for Great Britain'.<ref name=pti/>
Once a year all the schedules for the county by all modes (including the information collected and maintained by Traveline) is assembled into the [[National Public Transport Data Repository]] which is prepared every October is used for the creation of Core Accessibility Indicators for every part of the UK.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pti.org.uk/docs/NPTDRspec.doc|title=National Public Transport Data Repository|work=PTI|accessdate=8 February 2010}}</ref> This data is also used within products such as [[MySociety]]'s [[Mapumental]].
Some bus operators provide information via the Electronic Bus Service Registration (EBSR) system using the [[TransXChange]] when passing information between operators, [[Vehicle and Operator Services Agency]] (VOSA), Traveline.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dft.gov.uk/vosa/newsandevents/pressreleases/2008pressreleases/01-02-08newbusregistrationsystemtoimprovereal-timeinformationforpassengers.htm|title=01-02-08 New bus registration system to improve real-time information for passengers|publisher=Department for Transport|accessdate=27 March 2010}}</ref>
==Organisational structure== For operational and data preparation purposes the UK is divided in the following regions/nations:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.traveline.org.uk/index.htm|title=Public Transport Information|publisher=Traveline|accessdate=8 February 2010}}</ref> The boundaries are not identical to the [[Regions of England]].
{| class="wikitable unsortable" |- ! Name ! Members ! Notes |- ||Cymru/[[Wales]]|||| |- |East Anglia||[[Cambridgeshire]], [[Norfolk]] and [[Suffolk]]|| |- |East Midlands||[[Derby]], [[Derbyshire]], [[Leicester]], [[Leicestershire]], [[Lincolnshire]], [[Northamptonshire]], [[North East Lincolnshire]], [[North Lincolnshire]], [[Nottingham]], [[Nottinghamshire]], [[Peterborough]], [[Rutland]]|| |- |London||[[Transport for London]]|| |- |North East & Cumbria||[[Cumbria]], [[Darlington]], [[Durham, England|Durham]], [[Hartlepool]], [[Middlesbrough]], [[Northumberland]], [[Redcar and Cleveland]], [[Stockton-on-Tees]], [[Tyne and Wear]]|| |- |[[Northern Ireland]]|||| |- |North West||[[Blackburn with Darwen]], [[Blackpool]], [[Cheshire East]], [[Cheshire West and Chester]], [[Greater Manchester]], [[Halton, Cheshire|Halton]], [[Lancashire]], [[Merseyside]], [[Warrington]]|| |- |[[Scotland]]|||| |- |South East (excluding London)||[[Bedford]], [[Bracknell Forest]], [[Brighton and Hove]], [[Buckinghamshire]], [[Central Bedfordshire]], [[East Sussex]], [[Essex]], [[Hertfordshire]], [[Isle of Wight]], [[Kent]], [[Luton]], [[Medway]], [[Milton Keynes]], [[Oxfordshire]], [[Reading, Berkshire|Reading]], [[Slough]], [[Southend-on-Sea]], [[Surrey]], [[Thurrock]], [[West Berkshire]], [[West Sussex]], [[Windsor and Maidenhead]] and [[Wokingham]]|| |- |South West||[[Bath and North East Somerset]], [[Bournemouth]], [[Bristol]], [[Cornwall|Cornwall and Isles of Scilly]], [[Devon]], [[Dorset]], [[Gloucestershire]], [[Hampshire]], [[North Somerset]], [[Plymouth]], [[Poole]], [[Portsmouth]], [[Somerset]], [[Southampton]], [[South Gloucestershire]], [[Swindon]], [[Torbay]] and [[Wiltshire]]|| |- |West Midlands||[[Herefordshire]], [[Shropshire]], [[Staffordshire]], [[Stoke-on-Trent]], [[Telford and Wrekin]], [[Warwickshire]], [[West Midlands (county)|West Midlands]] and [[Worcestershire]]|| |- |Yorkshire||[[East Riding of Yorkshire]], [[Kingston upon Hull]], [[North Yorkshire]], [[South Yorkshire]], [[West Yorkshire]] and [[York]]|| |- |}
===Advisory body=== The advisory body of the national organisation consists of the following organisations:-<ref name=about/> * [[Confederation of Passenger Transport]] (CPT) * [[Association of Train Operating Companies]] (ATOC) * [[Local Government Association]] (LGA) * Confederation of Scottish Local Authorities (CoSLA) * [[Transport for London]] (TfL) * [[Passenger transport executive|Passenger Transport Executives Group]] (PTEG) * [[Association of Transport Coordinating Officers]] (ATCO) * [[Welsh Assembly Government]] (WAG) * [[Scottish Government]] * [[Department for Transport]] (DfT) * Translink
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.traveline.info/ Traveline official website]
[[Category:British websites]] [[Category:Public transport information systems]] [[Category:Route planning websites]] [[Category:Sustainable transport]] [[Category:Transport in the United Kingdom]]

page.title: Tuen Mun - Chek Lap Kok TBM

revision.text:
The '''Tuen Mun - Chek Lap Kok TBM''' is the world's largest [[tunnel boring machine]] launched in June 2015 by [[Herrenknecht]] in Germany. The [[Tunnel boring machine|TBM]] is used to drill a 5 km tunnel connecting [[Tuen Mun]] to the [[Hong Kong International Airport]], part of the [[Tuen Mun–Chek Lap Kok Link]] project. The machine has a diameter of 17.6 m<ref>http://www.cob.nl/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/KIVITTOW_20160922_Herrenknecht.pdf</ref>, 0.2 m more than [[Bertha (tunnel boring machine)|Bertha]], the previous largest [[tunnel boring machine]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.geplus.co.uk/news/bouygues-confirms-largest-tunnel-boring-machine-launch/8684451.article|title=bouygues confirms largest tunnel boring machine launch|date=9 June 2015|website=geeplus.co.uk|accessdate=2015-12-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eic-federation.eu/media/uploads/ga_rotterdam_2015/4_herrenknecht_lehmann_eic.pdf|title=Long-Term Relations Between Joint Venture Partners – A Supplier’s Perspective|website=eic-federation.eu|accessdate=2015-12-11}}</ref>
==Operations==
The machine will excavate a 5 km-long underwater tunnel, working at pressures as high as 5 bars. The drilling will take place in depths of up to 50 m below sea level.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tunneltalk.com/Hong-Kong-15Sep2014-Tuen-Mun-Check-Lap-Kok-Link-world-record-TBM.php|title=Hong Kong mega-machine explanations|date=25 September 2014|website=tunneltalk.com|accessdate=2015-12-11}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.tunneltalk.com/ tunneltalk website] [[Category:Heavy equipment]] [[Category:Tunnel boring machine]]

A '''water-jet printer''' (or '''waterjet printer''') is a [[printer (computing)|printer]] that makes use of [[paper]] coated with special [[dye]]s and [[ink cartridge]]s filled with water to print paper copies of documents.<ref name="abc">{{cite journal|last=Lan Sheng|title=Hydrochromic molecular switches for water-jet rewritable paper|journal=Nature Communications|date=28 January 2014|volume=5|doi=10.1038/ncomms4044 |display-authors=etal|pmid=24472877|page=3044}}</ref> Using paper treated with [[oxazolidine]], the water jet changes the colour of the chemical to produce a print which fades in about a day, depending on [[temperature]], and the paper can be re-used rather than being disposed of. The print fades away within about 22 hours at temperatures below 35 degrees [[Celsius]] (95 degrees [[Fahrenheit]]) as the water [[evaporation|evaporates]]. While the chemical treatment makes the paper slightly more expensive, use of water instead of ink in the printer makes it much cheaper overall, and the only change needed to the printer is to replace what's in the cartridge.<ref>{{cite web|title=Chemists unveil 'water-jet' printer|url=http://phys.org/news/2014-01-chemists-unveil-water-jet-printer.html|accessdate=31 January 2014}}</ref>
The [[technology]] for water-jet printing was developed by a team of Chinese scientists led by Sean Xiao-An Zhang, a [[chemistry]] [[professor]] at [[Jilin University]] in [[China]].<ref name="abc"/>
To create rewritable paper the researchers used four [[oxazolidine]]s. Some of the [[isomer]]s of these oxazolidines are colourless in the absence of water. But when the paper is wetted the water changes the dyes’ absorption of visible light. The exact [[wavelength]]s absorbed vary with the compound used, which allows printing in a variety of colours. The rewriteable paper was made by first coating ordinary paper with a layer of [[polyethylene glycol]] (PEG) to prevent it reacting with the dye, before a second layer of PEG containing the chosen dye was laid on top. Finally, another layer of PEG was added to prevent the dye absorbing water from the air or, conversely, losing water too quickly. The team used a commercial inkjet printer and a cartridge filled with water to print trial documents. The printed page is dry to the touch and the print can be rapidly ‘erased’ by heating it to 70 °C. The print remained legible for around 22 hours before evaporation wiped the page clean. Paper prepared in this way can be printed on and then erased more than 50 times.<ref>{{cite web|last=Tim Wogan|title='Waterjet' printer set to make a splash|url=http://www.rsc.org/chemistryworld/2014/01/waterjet-printer-rewriteable-paper-set-make-splash|publisher=Royal Society of Chemistry|accessdate=31 January 2014}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Computer printers]] [[Category:Non-impact printing]] [[Category:Office equipment]]

{{Main|Blackboard Inc.}} '''WebCT''' (Course Tools) or '''Blackboard Learning System''',<ref>http://www.blackboard.com/</ref> now owned by [[Blackboard Inc.|Blackboard]], is an [[online]] [[Proprietary software|proprietary]] [[virtual learning environment]] system that is licensed to colleges and other institutions and used in many [[campus]]es for [[e-learning]]. To their WebCT courses, instructors can add such tools as discussion boards, mail systems, and live chat, along with content including documents and web pages. The latest versions of this software are now called Webcourses. WebCT is significant in that it was the world's first widely successful course management system for higher education. At its height, it was in use by over 10 million students in 80 countries.<ref name=goldberg/>
==Background== WebCT was originally developed at the [[University of British Columbia]] by a faculty member in computer science, [[Murray Goldberg]]. Goldberg is also the creator of Silicon Chalk (sold to Wimba<ref>[http://www.redorbit.com/news/technology/224250/horizon_wimba_acquires_silicon_chalk/index.html Horizon Wimba Acquires Silicon Chalk]</ref> [http://www.wimba.com (website)]) and Brainify [https://web.archive.org/web/20090204164850/http://brainify.com/ (website)] an academic social bookmarking and networking site. In 1995, Goldberg began looking at the application of web-based systems to education.<ref name="goldberg">[http://news.ubc.ca/ubcnewsdigest/2004/04oct15.html#4 UBC Computer Scientist Wins $100,000 Award for Popular Course Software, University of British Columbia News & Events, September 29, 2004]</ref> His research showed that student satisfaction and academic performance could be improved through the use of a web-based educational resource, or web-based course tools (from which the name WebCT is derived).{Goldberg, M., Salari, S. & Swoboda, P. (1996) ‘World Wide Web – Course Tool: An Environment for Building WWW-Based Courses’ Computer Networks and ISDN Systems, 28:7-11 pp1219-1231} In order to continue his research, he decided to build a system to ease the creation of web-based learning environments. This led to the first version of WebCT in early 1996, first presented at the 5th international World Wide Web conference in Paris during the spring of 1996.
In 1997, Goldberg created a company, WebCT Educational Technologies Corporation, a spinoff company of UBC.{{deadlink|date=October 2012}}<ref name=goldberg/> Goldberg grew the company until 1999, at which point it served approximately 2-3 million students in 30 countries. In mid-1999, WebCT was acquired by ULT (Universal Learning Technology),{{deadlink|date=October 2012}}<ref name=goldberg/><ref>[https://archive.is/20120710183128/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0EIN/is_1999_May_17/ai_54643876 Universal Learning Technology Acquires WebCT, Business Wire, May 17, 1999]</ref> a Boston-based company headed by Carol Vallone. Ms. Vallone continued to grow the company to the point where its product was used by over 10 million students in 80 countries.{{deadlink|date=October 2012}}<ref name=goldberg/> Goldberg resigned from his position of Canadian president of WebCT in 2002. In February 2006, WebCT was acquired by rival [[Blackboard Inc.|Blackboard]] Inc.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20170418165057/https://magic.piktochart.com/output/21792118-aolaim-smtp-settings-mail-not-working-troubleshooting-usuk Aol Mail not working]</ref> As part of the acquisition terms with Blackboard, the WebCT name will be phased out in favor of the Blackboard brand. The majority of WebCT users moved away from Blackboard LMS. Many selected an open source LMS.<ref>http://listedtech.com/webct-and-how-it-helped-open-source/</ref>
==Textbooks and publishing== The software was used in [[electronic publishing]]. In order to use a [[textbook]] or other learning tool published in the WebCT format, some publishers require the student to purchase a [[password]] at the bookstore or to obtain it online. The software permitted integration of material prepared locally with material purchased from publishers.
==Criticisms==
WebCT's user interface has been criticized as needlessly complex and unintuitive. The "[[WebCT Vista|Vista]]" version of the product represented an attempt to derive balance between flexibility and ease of use, however it has also been the target of ease-of-use criticisms.
Some WebCT criticisms which were apparent include problems using it in multiple tabs or browser windows, heavy reliance on [[Java (programming language)|Java]] for its user experience,<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20070116051757/http://clt.lse.ac.uk/Help/VLE-Pilot/WebCT-6-Java-Install.php WebCT Java Problems, Centre for Learning Technology, London School of Economics and Science 2008]</ref> usage of too many browser [[HTML element#Frames|framesets]], issues with some features requiring pop-up blockers to be turned off, and problems using standard browser navigation tools (i.e. the Back and Forward commands).
WebCT, like most of its competitors, does not meet all guidelines for accessibility; these include, but are not limited to, the following studies: * [http://www.w3.org/WAI/AU/2002/WebCT3_6.html ''Conformance of WebCT v3.6 to W3C's Authoring Tool Accessibility Guidelines 1.0(2001)''] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060321081953/http://booboo.webct.com/2001/papers/Gergely.pdf ''Bringing Your WebCT Course into ADA Compliance: A Nuts and Bolts Approach (2001)''] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060819211246/http://ausweb.scu.edu.au/aw02/papers/refereed/alexander/paper.html ''An Accessibility Audit of WebCT (2002)''] * [http://www.utas.edu.au/accessibility/webct/is_webct_accessible.html ''Is WebCT Vista Accessible? (2006)'']
==See also== {{wikiversity}} *[[Cusis|CUSIS]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QlWoefy5B0w Video of Murray Goldberg presenting WebCT at CICEI in 1998] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060314145538/http://www.webct.com/content/viewpage?name=company_content_partners Content providers] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060113234803/http://www.webct.com/products/viewpage?name=products_demo_webinars Demonstrations and examples of courses developed using the software (Campus edition)] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20170418165057/https://magic.piktochart.com/output/21792118-aolaim-smtp-settings-mail-not-working-troubleshooting-usuk Aol mail Not working] Support and Documentation for Blackboard CE users, by Brock University, Ontario, Canada * [http://www.blackboard.com/ Blackboard home page]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Webct}} [[Category:Educational technology companies]] [[Category:Virtual learning environments]] [[Category:Learning management systems]]

revision.comment: Without context it's difficult to distinguish jokes from jokily expressed truths. Better to just require secondary sources. This is a BLP, and a contentious one at that, so let's try to be more careful.
revision.text:
{{short description|American video game developer, programmer, writer, and artist}} {{pp-move-indef}} {{pp-blp|small=yes}} {{Use American English|date=November 2018}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox person |name = Zoë Quinn |image = Zoe Quinn Car 2014.jpg |caption = Quinn in 2014 |other_names = Zoë Tiberius Quinn |birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1987}} |birth_place = United States |known_for = ''[[Depression Quest]]'' |occupation = [[Video game developer]] |website = {{URL|https://unburntwitch.com/}} }}
'''Zoë Tiberius Quinn'''<ref>{{cite tweet |last=Quinn |first=Zoë |user=UnburntWitch |number=580790835530219520 |date=March 25, 2015 |accessdate=August 18, 2016 |title=Y'all thought i was playin about my middle name}}</ref> (born 1987) is an American [[video game developer]], [[video game programmer|programmer]], writer, and artist. She developed the [[interactive fiction]] game ''[[Depression Quest]]'', which was released in 2013. In 2014, a blog post by her ex-boyfriend sparked the [[Gamergate controversy]], in which Quinn was subjected to extensive harassment.
== Early life == Zoë Tiberius Quinn was born in 1987 and grew up in a small town near the [[Adirondack Mountains]] in New York.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bostonmagazine.com/news/2015/04/28/gamergate/3/ |title=Game of Fear |website=[[Boston Magazine]] |date=April 28, 2015 |accessdate=May 14, 2015 |first=Zachary |last=Jason}}</ref> Growing up, she often played [[video games]]. A favorite of hers was ''[[Commander Keen]]'', an [[MS-DOS]] game featuring an eight-year-old [[protagonist]] who builds a spaceship with items found around his house and then travels the Galaxy defending the Earth. As a teenager, she suffered from depression and was diagnosed with the condition at the age of 14. She has described receiving little sympathy or assistance from [[school district]] officials and says they were "less than understanding about teens with depression and suicide issues".<ref name="NewYorker">{{cite web |url=https://www.newyorker.com/tech/annals-of-technology/zoe-quinns-depression-quest |title=Zoe Quinn's Depression Quest |last=Parkin |first=Simon |website=The New Yorker |date=September 9, 2014 |accessdate=September 15, 2014}}</ref>
== Career == At the age of 24, Quinn moved to Canada and made her first foray into video game programming. Her first game was the result of a six-week course on video game creation that she attended after seeing an advertisement in a newspaper. In a later interview for ''[[The New Yorker]]'', she said, "I felt like I'd found my calling."<ref name="NewYorker" />
=== ''Depression Quest'' === {{Main|Depression Quest}} One of Quinn's earliest creative works, ''[[Depression Quest]]'', was conceived as a "choose-your-own path" adventure detailing the troubled life of a person suffering from depression,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.edge-online.com/news/why-the-co-creator-of-depression-quest-is-fighting-back-against-internet-trolls/ |title=Why the co-creator of Depression Quest is fighting back against Internet trolls |author=<!-- Staff writers --> |date=January 23, 2014 |website=Edge |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141028002907/http://www.edge-online.com/news/why-the-co-creator-of-depression-quest-is-fighting-back-against-internet-trolls/ |archivedate=October 28, 2014 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=May 30, 2014}}</ref> with many of the "correct" paths blocked due to the protagonists' struggle with mental self-care. Quinn thought this sort of game narrative would be a good way to depict depression, imposing a set of rules on players they might not experience in their day-to-day lives. ''Depression Quest'' was released in February 2013.<ref name="NewYorker" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gamepolitics.com/2014/08/13/depression-quest-now-available-steam |title='Depression Quest' Now Available on Steam |date=August 13, 2014 |website=Game Politics |accessdate=August 23, 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160528222556/http://gamepolitics.com/2014/08/13/depression-quest-now-available-steam/ |archivedate=May 28, 2016}}</ref>
Quinn attempted to publish the game on [[Steam Greenlight]] service twice — in December 2013 and later in August 2014, when it was accepted and released by Steam.<ref>{{cite web |title=Depression Quest Now Available on Steam for Free |url=https://www.ausgamers.com/news/read/3465218/depression-quest-now-available-on-steam-for-free |website=AusGamers |accessdate=August 18, 2014}}</ref> ''Depression Quest'' was featured in a ''[[Playboy (magazine)|Playboy]]'' article as one of several video games dealing with the subjective experience of [[Major depressive disorder|depression]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Rougeau |first1=Mike |title=Resistance is Futile: The New Wave of Video Games about Depression |url=http://www.playboy.com/articles/video-games-about-depression |website=[[Playboy.com]] |accessdate=November 27, 2014 |date=November 25, 2014}}</ref>
=== Other projects === Quinn created the Game Developer Help List, designed to bring experienced game developers and novice developers into contact with one another.<ref>{{cite web |last=Wawro |first=Alex |title=Game Developer Help List rallies industry vets to aid rookie devs |url=https://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/207278/Game_Developer_Help_List_rallies_industry_vets_to_aid_rookie_devs.php |website=Gamasutra |date=December 18, 2013 |accessdate=September 17, 2014}}</ref> In 2014, she was intended to be part of the canceled [[YouTube]] reality television show codenamed "Game_Jam", which was meant to bring together a number of prominent indie game developers.<ref>{{cite web |last=Matulef |first=Jeffrey |title=Game jam reality show cancelled as indies wouldn't put up with its s*** |url=https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2014-04-01-game-jam-reality-show-cancelled-as-indies-wouldnt-put-up-with-its-s |website=Eurogamer |date=April 1, 2014 |accessdate=September 17, 2014}}</ref>
In 2015, she served as a [[narrative designer|narrative design]] consultant<ref>{{cite web |title=Framed Press Kit |url=http://framed-game.com/presskit/sheet.php?p=framed |website=Loveshack Entertainment |accessdate=August 3, 2015}}</ref> for Loveshack Entertainment's [[iOS]] game ''Framed''.<ref>{{cite web |first=Daniel Nye |last=Griffiths |title=Quest Love – 'Depression Quest' Creator Zoe Quinn Joins Hot Indie 'Framed' |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/danielnyegriffiths/2014/04/30/loveshack-entertainment-framed-adds-depression-quest-creator-quinn/ |date=April 30, 2014 |accessdate=September 17, 2014}}</ref> As of 2014 she was also working on a [[full motion video]] game starring [[Greg Sestero]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Donaldson |first=Ricky |title=Zoe Quinn's Follow Up To Depression Quest is a FMV Game |url=https://twinfinite.net/2014/04/zoe-quinns-follow-depression-quest-fmv-game/ |date=April 18, 2014 |accessdate=September 17, 2014}}</ref>
In 2015, Quinn wrote a chapter for ''Videogames for Humans'', a book about games made using the [[Twine (software)|Twine]] tool.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Joseph |first1=Daniel |title=What's a Twine Game? Let 'Videogames for Humans' Show You |url=https://motherboard.vice.com/en_us/article/4x3eyn/whats-a-twine-game-let-videogames-for-humans-show-you |accessdate=August 24, 2015 |website=[[Vice (magazine)|Motherboard]] |date=May 4, 2015}}</ref> She also contributed a chapter to the book ''The State of Play: Sixteen Voices on Video Games,'' detailing her experiences making ''Depression Quest'' and the subsequent harassment she faced.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Tremblay |first1=Kaitlin |title=Review: What Is The State of Play in Video Games Right Now? |url=https://www.themarysue.com/state-of-play/ |accessdate=August 24, 2015 |website=[[The Mary Sue]] |date=August 20, 2015}}</ref> In 2015, she appeared in the documentary ''[[GTFO (film)|GTFO]]''.<ref>{{cite web |website=[[The New York Times]] |title=In the Documentary 'GTFO,' Female Video Gamers Fight Back |first=Robert |last=Ito |date=March 6, 2015 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/08/movies/in-the-documentary-gtfo-female-video-gamers-fight-back.html |accessdate=March 9, 2015}}</ref> She also wrote a scenario for "Widow's Walk", an expansion for ''[[Betrayal at House on the Hill]]'', released in 2016.<ref>{{cite web |first=Charlie |last=Hall |title=Betrayal at House on the Hill expansion is here in time for Halloween |url=https://www.polygon.com/2016/10/18/13309838/betrayal-at-house-on-the-hill-expansion |date=October 18, 2016 |accessdate=November 4, 2016}}</ref>
Quinn is currently working with erotica author [[Chuck Tingle]] on a full motion [[dating sim]] under the working title "Project Tingler".<ref>{{cite web |first=Phillippa |last=Warr |title=Zoe Quinn's FMV Chuck Tingle Dating Sim |url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2016/09/01/zoe-quinn-project-tingler/ |date=September 1, 2016 |accessdate=November 4, 2016}}</ref> In January 2018, her role as Narrative Designer at Heart Machine<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.heart-machine.com/our-team/ |title=Heart Machine {{!}} The Heart Machine Team |website=www.heart-machine.com |accessdate=April 5, 2018}}</ref> on a new, unannounced project was also announced.<ref>{{cite tweet |author=AlxPreston |user=HeartMachineZ |number=950562174883184640 |title=It's the start of a new year, so it's the perfect time to update our team page. Here's who's involved (so far) in our next project: [...] |date=January 8, 2018 |accessdate=April 5, 2018}}</ref> In June 2018, it was announced that Quinn was working with Robbi Rodriguez on [[Vertigo (DC Comics)|DC Vertigo]]'s ''Goddess Mode''.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Hudson |first1=Laura |title=Vertigo Comics to relaunch with seven new titles, including one by Zoe Quinn |url=https://www.theverge.com/2018/6/7/17438910/dc-vertigo-comics-relaunch-zoe-quinn-goddess-mode |website=The Verge |accessdate=September 9, 2018 |date=June 7, 2018}}</ref>
She has additionally worked on ''[[Fez (video game)|Fez]]'', ''[[Jazzpunk]]'',<ref name=GiantBombJP>[https://www.giantbomb.com/jazzpunk/3030-44063/credits/ Jazzpunk Credits]. [[Giant Bomb]].</ref> and ''[[They Bleed Pixels]]''.{{Citation needed|date=August 2018}}
=== Harassment and Gamergate === {{Main|Gamergate controversy}} In August 2014, Eron Gjoni, a former boyfriend of Quinn, posted a lengthy blog post detailing his relationship with Quinn. Based on the contents of the post, Quinn was falsely accused of receiving positive coverage from a journalist with whom she was in a relationship. It was later shown that the journalist in question had only once briefly mentioned Quinn's work, and not while they were in a relationship.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/culturenews/11180510/gamergate-misogynist-felicia-day-zoe-quinn-brianna-wu.html |title=#GamerGate: the misogynist movement blighting the video games industry |last=Stuart |first=Bob |date=October 24, 2014 |website=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=August 31, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Parkin |first=Simon |url=https://www.newyorker.com/tech/annals-of-technology/gamergate-scandal-erupts-video-game-community |title=Gamergate: A Scandal Erupts in the Video-Game Community |website=[[The New Yorker]] |date=October 17, 2014 |accessdate=February 9, 2016}}</ref> These accusations sparked the Gamergate controversy. Quinn suffered a long period of harassment including [[doxing]], rape threats, and death threats.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Heron |first1=Michael James |last2=Belford |first2=Pauline |last3=Goker |first3=Ayse |title=Sexism in the circuitry |journal=ACM SIGCAS Computers and Society |publisher=[[Association for Computing Machinery]] |volume=44 |issue=4 |year=2014 |pages=18–29 |issn=0095-2737 |doi=10.1145/2695577.2695582}}</ref> Harassment associated with Gamergate resulted in widespread recognition of sexism in gaming.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/fed-up-game-developers-sign-open-letter-2014-9 |title=Game Developers Are Finally Stepping Up To Change Their Hate-Filled Industry |first1=Karyne |last1=Levy |website=[[Business Insider]] |date=September 2, 2014 |accessdate=September 7, 2014 |quote=The game industry has been in the spotlight for the past week, with several incidents of harassment and sexism making headlines.}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2014/09/12/with-gamergate-the-video-game-industrys-growing-pains-go-viral/ |title=With #GamerGate, the video-game industry's growing pains go viral |first=Sarah |last=Kaplan |date=September 12, 2014 |accessdate=September 14, 2014 |website=[[The Washington Post]]}}</ref>
According to ''The New Yorker'', the harassment escalated to the point where Quinn, "fearing for her safety, chose to leave her home" and began working with the authorities to identify those responsible for the harassment.<ref name="NewYorker" /> She detailed the experience in an interview on [[MSNBC]]'s ''[[Ronan Farrow Daily]],'' saying that Gamergate represented a rapidly shrinking fringe among an increasingly diverse gaming community and those attacking Quinn and other women in gaming needed "to just grow up".<ref>{{cite episode |title=Exclusive: Woman who sparked Gamergate |series=[[Ronan Farrow Daily]] |station=[[MSNBC.com]] |url=https://www.msnbc.com/ronan-farrow-daily/watch/exclusive--woman-who-sparked-gamergate-345327171549 |accessdate=November 27, 2014 |date=October 20, 2014}}</ref> Speaking with [[BBC News]], Quinn said the harassment had consumed her life, leading her to feel as if "surrounded by nothing but hate — it's virulent, it's everywhere" and that she was "just trying to survive". The attacks boiled down to "the same accusation everybody makes toward every successful woman: she got to where she is because she had sex with someone" and she also pointed out that Gamergate had targeted "the people with the least power in the industry". "[I] used to go to games events and feel like I was going home... Now it's just like... are any of the people I'm currently in the room with, the ones that said they wanted to beat me to death?"<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-29821050 |title=Zoe Quinn: GamerGate must be condemned |website=[[BBC News Online|BBC News]] |date=October 29, 2014 |accessdate=November 27, 2014 |last=Lee |first=Dave}}</ref> Quinn says her therapist remarked of the harassment, "I don't even know what to tell you, this is so {{as written|f-‍-‍-ing}} far outside anything I'm aware of."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-11-26/anita-sarkeesian-battles-sexism-in-games-gamergate-harassment |first=Sheelah |last=Kolhatkar |title=The Gaming Industry's Greatest Adversary Is Just Getting Started |website=[[Bloomberg Businessweek]] |date=November 26, 2014 |accessdate=November 26, 2014}}</ref>
In January 2015, Quinn co-founded [[Crash Override Network|Crash Override]], a private network of experts to assist victims of online harassment<ref>{{cite web |last=Mendoza |first=Jessica |url=https://www.csmonitor.com/Technology/Tech-Culture/2015/0120/Online-harassment-targets-strike-back-against-abusers.-Will-it-work |title=Online harassment targets strike back against abusers. Will it work? |website=[[The Christian Science Monitor]] |date=January 20, 2015 |accessdate=January 21, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wired.com/2015/01/gamergate-anti-harassment-network/ |title=Gamergate Target Zoe Quinn Launches Anti-Harassment Support Network |last=Hudson |first=Laura |website=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |date=January 20, 2015 |accessdate=January 22, 2015}}</ref> which in March 2015 joined forces with Randi Harper's [[Online Abuse Prevention Initiative]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Takahashi |first=Dean |url=https://venturebeat.com/2015/03/04/zoe-quinn-and-other-female-game-developers-speak-out-against-harassment/ |title=Zoe Quinn and other female game developers speak out against harassment |date=March 3, 2015 |website=[[VentureBeat]] |accessdate=March 5, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Weunberger |first=Matt |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/zoe-quinn-gamergate-developer-how-to-protect-yourself-2015-3 |title=Zoe Quinn, Gamergate developer: How to protect yourself |date=March 4, 2015 |website=[[Business Insider]] |accessdate=March 5, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/digits/2015/03/04/game-developer-the-gaming-industry-is-not-doing-enough-to-combat-misogyny/ |title=Game Developer: The Gaming Industry Is Not Doing Enough to Combat Misogyny |first=Sarah E. |last=Needleman |date=March 4, 2015 |website=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |accessdate=March 6, 2015}}</ref> [[File:Ripple Effect - How Women-in-Games Initiatives Make a Difference - GDC 2016 (25571530440).jpg|thumb|Quinn (second from the left) speaking at the [[Game Developers Conference]] in March 2016]] On September 24, 2015, she spoke at the [[United Nations]] along with [[Anita Sarkeesian]] about online harassment. In her speech, Quinn spoke about the need for technology companies to provide proper moderation and terms of service which protect marginalized groups. She also raised concerns about providing better protections for transgender women and victims of domestic violence on the Internet.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://webtv.un.org/search/launch-of-the-broadband-working-group-on-gender-report/4506718502001/ |title=Launch of the Broadband Working Group on Gender Report |website=United Nations Web TV}}</ref>
In September 2017, she published the memoir ''[[Crash Override (book)|Crash Override: How Gamergate (Nearly) Destroyed My Life, and How We Can Win the Fight Against Online Hate]]''.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Campbell |first1=Colin |title=Zoë Quinn tells her story |url=https://www.polygon.com/features/2017/9/6/16262830/zoe-quinn-book-review-gamergate-crash-override |website=Polygon |accessdate=September 15, 2017 |date=September 6, 2017}}</ref> The book has received generally positive reviews, with critics praising Quinn's thoughtful, nuanced portrayal of her harassers, but lamenting the book's "scattered" narrative flow.<ref>{{cite journal |title=Rev. of Crash Override by Zoë Quinn |journal=[[Kirkus Reviews]] |date=June 5, 2017 |url=https://www.kirkusreviews.com/book-reviews/zoe-quinn/crash-override/}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Peterson |first1=Latoya |title=In 'Crash Override,' Zoe Quinn Shares Her Boss Battle Against Online Harassment |url=https://www.npr.org/2017/09/08/548661962/in-crash-override-zoe-quinn-shares-her-boss-battle-against-online-harassment |website=NPR.org |accessdate=September 15, 2017}}</ref> The book was nominated for the 2018 [[Hugo Award]] for [[Hugo Award for Best Related Work|Best Related Work]] (''i.e.'', non-fiction work related to [[science fiction]] or [[fantasy]]).<ref>[https://www.tor.com/2018/03/31/2018-hugo-award-finalists-announced/ "2018 Hugo Award Finalists Announced" Tor.com 3-31-2018]</ref>
== Personal life == Quinn is interested in [[human enhancement]], and has implanted an NTAG216 chip in the back of her hand that can be programmed to perform various functions. Her first use of the chip was to load it with the download code for the game ''[[Deus Ex (video game)|Deus Ex]].''<ref name="Hernandez">{{cite web |last=Hernandez |first=Patricia |title=Woman puts Deus Ex on computer chip in her hand |url=https://kotaku.com/woman-puts-deus-ex-on-computer-chip-in-her-hand-1573033542 |website=Kotaku |date=May 7, 2014 |accessdate=September 17, 2014}}</ref> She also has a magnetic implant in her left [[ring finger]].<ref name="Hernandez" /><ref>{{cite web |last=Pepitone |first=Julianne |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/innovation/cyborgs-among-us-human-biohackers-embed-chips-their-bodies-n150756 |title=Cyborgs Among Us: Human 'Biohackers' Embed Chips In Their Bodies |website=NBC News |date=July 11, 2014 |accessdate=May 12, 2015}}</ref>
== Bibliography == * {{cite book |last=Quinn |first=Zoe |year=2017 |title=[[Crash Override (book)|Crash Override: How Gamergate (Nearly) Destroyed My Life, and How We Can Win the Fight Against Online Hate]] |publisher=[[PublicAffairs]] |location=[[New York City, NY]] |isbn=978-1610398084}}
== References == {{Reflist}}
== Further reading == {{refbegin}} * {{cite web |title=Gamergate Target Zoe Quinn Can Teach Us How to Fight Online Hate |website=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |date=September 2, 2017 |url=https://www.wired.com/2017/09/geeks-guide-zoe-quinn/}} * {{cite web |last=Illing |first=Sean |title=The woman at the center of #Gamergate gives zero fucks about her haters |url=https://www.vox.com/culture/2017/9/19/16301682/gamergate-alt-right-zoe-quinn-crash-override-interview |website=Vox |date=September 9, 2017}}
{{refend}}
